summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, approving proposed redactions to protect the privacy of alleged victims, witnesses, and non-parties. The order directs the parties to file the redacted materials on the public docket by November 12, 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the court order.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The United States District Judge who issued the order approving redactions and sealing of exhibits.

events.title: Court Order on Redactions
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issued an order approving proposed redactions and sealing of certain exhibits in the Ghislaine Maxwell case to protect privacy interests.

events.title: Deadline for Filing Redacted Materials
events.description: The parties are ordered to file the proposed redactions and accompanying exhibits on the public docket by this date.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The court approved redactions and sealing of exhibits to protect the pre-trial privacy interests of alleged victims, anticipated witnesses, and non-parties.
The redactions were deemed consistent with legal standards and narrowly tailored.
The order was issued in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20-CR-330).
